channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8611] Improve test coverage in pkg org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapred
item.summary: Improve test coverage in pkg org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapred

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 20 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

Results :



Tests run: 28, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0

My only request is for more comments. Tests names are nice, but test comments are helpful for test maintainers and super helpful for new users looking to learn APIs.

+1 from me otherwise.
Reattached: LauncherSecurityManager class usage was removed

You can still write tests that use the SecurityManager implemented in HBASE-8534, in fact, I'd prefer both namespaces share the coverage and implementation. Just mark this ticket as dependent on that one.
Current implementation good for you or I should recreate patch with SecurityManager ?

Since HBASE-8534 has been merged to trunk and this one will conflict, please rebase and post. Also, please run your altered tests against the hadoop-2 profile, `mvn -Dhadoop.profile=2.0 ...` will do the trick.
There is not conflict between this and HBASE-8534

Sorry Valdim, you are correct. I've reviewed your patch more closely and I'm now +1 for commit...

Except, TestTableMapReduceUtil#shoudBeValidMapReduceEvaluation fails when I run locally on Hadoop2. Would you mind taking a look?

Here's the commands I ran and the surefire log output:

$ mvn -Dhadoop.profile=2.0 clean package -DskipTests

$ mvn -Dhadoop.profile=2.0 test -Dtest=org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapred.TestDriver,org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapred.TestGroupingTableMap,org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapred.TestIdentityTableMap,org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapred.TestRowCounter,org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapred.TestSplitTable,org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapred.TestTableMapReduceUtil

Interestingly, hadoop-7878386878750133423.jar does exist on my filesystem after the test execution terminates.

Ted Yu, Jonathan Hsieh: since you guys have been dogging these hadoop-2 failures, what's your preferred course of action here? My preference is for greater test coverage, so I support committing this patch and adding a ticket to HBASE-6891 for tracking the failure (if indeed it's reproducible, etc, etc).

Nick Dimiduk I'm fine with that approach. I'm not going to be able to work on it immediately but I believe Matteo Bertozzi will be investigating the remaining issues in the mean time and we'll want to get this done before 0.95 turns into 0.96.

Vadim Bondarev, tried applying the patch on trunk and it failed - was a simple fix and the fixed Driver.java changes are attached. I tried to run the tests outlined by Nick. It seems to be failing. Can you please take a look. The command I ran:
mvn clean -Dhadoop.profile=2.0 test -Dtest=org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapred.TestDriver,org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapred.TestGroupingTableMap,org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapred.TestIdentityTableMap,org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapred.TestRowCounter,org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapred.TestSplitTable,org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapred.TestTableMapReduceUtil

against trunk revision .

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.
